the comfort of ritual but this country
has been through wrenching change in the
last few years and now it's being told
to do more still the government has red
lines most Pensions have already been
cut by nearly 50% and here they agree
that's enough I'm worried not only about
the future of the pensions but the
future of the entire country if they cut
my pension again I will not be able to
pay any of my bills really none of them
but if you don't cut pensions you need
more revenue elsewhere on the island of
Edra they're getting ready for the peak
holiday season could more tax be raised
in a place like this the government says
a crackdown on tax evasion could bring
in billions but many believe that's an
over-ambitious guess the owner of this
restaurant overlooking the sea says the
key is hard work
Greece needs time and space to recover
the last five years the taxes go up and
up and up every year every year do you
need different ideas to make the money
give them the opportunity to the to the
people to make business left of the
economy free and after collect the money
the trouble is the country is running
out of cash right now the rhythm of the
Greek summer is supposed to be slow and
uncomplicated but the government and its
international creditors need to pick up
the pace
in the coming days and weeks because all
the while the risk of some kind of
miscalculation leading to Greek
bankruptcy are increasing and no one
knows where things could go from there
back in central Athens to many shops
have already shut down the applause
globe closed left right you can see
plenty of them none of them were closed
before the crisis manos has been driving
a taxi here for 13 years he too says
people want to work but Society has
become divided the middle class
disappeared almost disappeared and we
divided into categories the law so there
are poor people but there's also very
rich still yes in other words some
Greeks can afford to pay more but many
have already reached their limit one
reason why closing a deal between Greece
and its creditors is proving to be so
hard
Chris Morris BBC News Athens
